title: The Art of The Letter
content: I was invited to attend a lecture here in Pittsburgh, PA where Doyald Young is the guest speaker. I have read about a new book he has been working on and understand that it is in print. Anyone know where I can get a copy or does anyone have any more information.
author: heckman

comments.content:
perhaps this link might be of help:   
   
 [http://www.delphipress.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122216/http:/www.delphipress.com/)   
   
cheers, Dana

Doyald is on a tour, sponsored by Smart Papers, which published The Art of the Letter.   
The Art of the Letter is a condensed summary   
of Fonts & Logos and Logotypes & Letterforms. Doyald also sprinkled in some   
new material.   
Seeing him speak in person, here in LA, was   
a treat, and the Art of the Letter is a nice keepsake.   
   
So go see him!
Thanks for the info. I plan on it. Do you know where I can buy the book?

You'll get The Art of the Letter free as part of attending the lecture. (Since SmartPapers is publishing it as part of the tour, I don't believe you it's available for sale otherwise.) You'll also be able to purchase Doyald's other books at the lecture; or at least that was true here in Austin.

if you are unable to see Doyald,   
you can email Smart Papers and   
ask about getting a copy.   
   
email:   
samples \_AT\_ smartpapers.com   
   
 [http://www.smartpapers.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122216/http:/www.smartpapers.com/)

Tiffany, I just emailed someone in the sample   
department and alerted her to this thread.   
   
I'll let you know whether there's a reply.

a response from Smart Papers.   
   
"The piece is only being distributed at the Doyald Young event. The two   
go hand-in-hand. They are welcome to contact a SMART Sales Rep in their   
area and see if an event can be scheduled."   
   
Tiffany, maybe if you went to Doyald's site and emailed him directly ...   
perhaps he'd like to donate some samples to the TypeCon auction. At the very least,   
Smart Papers would be wise to look into   
TypeCon.   
   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122216im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

For a copy of The Art of the Letter e mail Kam Kinder At [Kam.Kinder@smartpapers.com](mailto:Kam.Kinder@smartpapers.com) and tell her that your AIGA will not be holding and event and she will send out out a copy
